Thanks kaleb, I made a round to solve this problem. I used heritrix src - 1.10.0 instead of 1.10.2 and it worked fine

Kaleb <lostokies@...> wrote:                                  Ahmed Ghozia,
 
 St.Ack touches on this issue here (The source is missing files):
 http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/3850
 
 Follow the directions in that link and download the latest trunk from
 SVN and it should build without issue.  
 
 Kaleb
 
 --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Ahmed Ghozia" <ghouzia@...>
 wrote:
 >
 > I am trying to build heritrix from source(1.10.2) using maven 1.0.2, I
 > am using jdk 1.6 and I exported the following variables on my machine:
 > 
 > export JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.6.0
 > export HERITRIX_HOME=/root/research/heritrix_src
 > export MAVEN_HOME=/root/research/sources/maven-1.0.2
 > $MAVEN_HOME/bin/install_repo.sh $HERITRIX_SRC_HOME/.maven/repository
 > $MAVEN_HOME/bin/maven -v
 > 
 > when I run the following command:
 > 
 > [root@localhost heritrix-1.10.2]# $MAVEN_HOME/bin/maven dist
 > 
 > It fails to download the following dependencies
 > (commons-io-20030203.000550.jar
 > commons-net-1.1.0.jar
 > commons-httpclient-2.0.jar
 > commons-lang-2.0.jar
 > commons-logging-1.0.3.jar
 > jsch-0.1.5.jar
 > commons-jelly-20030902.160215.jar (try downloading from
 > http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/jelly/)
 > commons-jelly-tags-velocity-20030303.205659.jar
 > velocity-1.4-dev.jar
 > )
 > 
 > It gives the error message:
 > Error retrieving artifact from
 >
 [http://www.ibiblio.org/maven/commons-io/jars/commons-io-20030203.000550.jar]:
 > java.io.IOException: Unknown error downloading; status code was: 301
 > 
 > 
 > I downloaded these dependencies manually, tried to add them manually
 > to every possible place but nothing changes, 
 > 
 > I added the statement
 > 
 > maven.repo.remote=http://repo1.maven.org/maven
 > 
 > to the project.properties file but also nothing changed.
 > 
 > Any help??????
 >
 
 
     
                       

 
---------------------------------
The fish are biting.

 nothing changes, <br> > <br> > I added the statement<br> > <br> > maven.repo.remote=<a href="http://repo1.maven.org/maven">http://repo1.<wbr>maven.org/<wbr>maven</a><br> > <br> > to the project.properties file but also nothing changed.<br> > <br> > Any help??????<br> ><br> <br> </div>     </div>          <!--End group email -->
